lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. I know it's November 1st and Halloween was last night, but that's bullshit because we would have missed Halloween, so we're doing it anyway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Halloween's when you want it to be!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently I have a type when it comes to Halloween costumes, but after having enough people send me pictures of new Dante, going, "He looks like you!" I was like, "Fuck it. I'm going to "embrace it." So yes, I guess we'll go around and introduce our costumes, because it sounds like fun right now. I'm Dante from Devil May Cry 5. The best I could do in one week's time, most of which was spent in London. What about you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm Sherlock Holmes, because that's the best I could do in two hours' time, after figuring out that I was supposed to do this while working on another project.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wasn't there face paint that could help complete the look?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, this is it. Nine dollars.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Mickey Mouse) Ha ha. I'm Kylo Ren. Ha ha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Mickey Mouse) Ooh! Sorry, dad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm Lisa Frank Castle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: By far the most put-together costume at this table.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Travis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm the bargain bin. I had a cowboy hat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I gave you some gloves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think these belong to an M&M character?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, or Pac-man. I'm not sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ey! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You look like you're trying to sell baked beans.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I was a panda last night. I didn't have a fucking costume. I wasn't wearing that again. That shit was hot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Sadly, we're missing Laura Bailey tonight. She is off doing rehearsals for BlizzCon tomorrow. I will be there as well both days, so those who are watching or are on the virtual ticket, check it out, because there's some fun stuff going on. Before we get into the rest of our announcements, first we have two fantastic sponsors tonight. The first of which is the fantastic Tor Books. Liam!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's T-O-R Books. I'm going to resume doing unspeakable things. (air hissing) Tor Books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kylo Walken?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think that was Jackie Mason.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Listen to him again, he has a very subtle Brooklyn accent always.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You actually directed him, so you would know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did one time, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He was great! It was a great project! I love Star Wars! I'm dressed as him! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Liam. Our fantastic returning second sponsor for tonight are our friends at D&D Beyond. Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you have somehow still not checked out D&D Beyond, it is the official digital toolset for Dungeons & Dragons. Everything is there at your fingertips: the source books, the digital character sheets, the homebrew content creation! Go to dndbeyond.com now to check out how easy they make playing D&D. Now, you guys all know that first and foremost, I am a filmmaker, and I am proud to announce that tonight I have teamed with D&D Beyond to create my first ever foray into stop-motion animation. I don't want to say it's better than The Nightmare Before Christmas, but I'll let you guys say that. Wait until you see it for yourself. Let's roll my film.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh my god, what have you done?! SAM (VO): (triumphant humming) (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wiener, thank you all for believing in this project. Also, my inspiration, my mentor, Hugh Janus, Mr. Janus, wherever he is. I think Hugh Janus is smiling down on all of us tonight. And of course, D&D Beyond, we did it guys! It took three years, but we did it. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done. Thank you, Sam, and thank you, our friends at D&D Beyond, for making this happen on a weekly basis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we were at a Halloween party yesterday. How did you have time for that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. We were in London two days ago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three years it's been in the works.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's been in post for months.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm so glad that Dreamworks was willing to work with you based on how much Disney you do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Also, I forgot I just announced I'm going to be at Loscon November 23rd through 25th. So if you're in LA and want to check out the convention, I'll be hanging out there and talking about D&D and voiceover and all sorts of things like that. Loscon: L-O-S-C-O-N. That's what I've got.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Check it out on youtube.com/criticalrole and I think that ends this batch. We'll be back very soon with the next batch of new guests and new stories with our fantastic host.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was really good, Matt. You did a great job. I watched it on the cab ride home from the airport.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh shit, thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was so good. Amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you. I didn't expect it to get as deep as it did but here we are. Anyway, hope you enjoy it. The next episode of All Work, No Play will debut this Friday at twitch.tv/criticalrole at 7PM Pacific Time. This week, Liam and Sam learn how to fire spin with our fantastic, our own, my wife, Marisha Ray.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You survived, clearly. Somehow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, the burn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were great, Marisha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was fun. I was honored.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm excited to see it. I've only seen bits and pieces, and it's pretty absurd.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your wife shines.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But only from the fire burns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, it was from the flames.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, failure to ignite. Check it out this Friday at 7PM Pacific. Travis, you have something to talk about?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been following them for years. If we hit our 25,000 dollar goal, we're going to host a special first-person shooter stream with me! Yeah. I used to be good. I'm not so much anymore since baby days, but I'm going to try. I'm going to have a montage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Deep down that rabbit hole for years. Oh my god. I liked playing with you. Never won, but I enjoyed the process.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you! Right? It's all about the commentary that happens, right? If we hit that goal we will do that. Details and to donate, you can see everything at critrole.com/osd.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thanks, Travis. Daylight savings time hits the US this week, so make sure for those that are outside of the US, as far as times you can check out the shows and the rest of our content, go to wheniscriticalrole.com for updated air times in your timezone. Keep an eye out on that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going to time change again here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. We gain an hour.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You fall back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We sleep longer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We gain an hour. They're archaic, unnecessary means of changing our times each year.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're getting two daylight savings times, because we had one in London too. So we get two hours. We should travel the world.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't think that works that way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm pretty sure it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You might be right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want a judgement call on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jet lag absolutely destroyed any gain we got.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. I'm well aware.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The turnout was insane. You guys broke MCM London, confusing all sorts of other guests about what the hell this thing is. I loved the fact that Kit Buss, our official artist from the first campaign, had a far longer line than Frank Miller the entire weekend. It was pretty fantastic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All the love in the world to Frank Miller.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The legendary Frank Miller.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is crazy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also lots of love to Kit Buss who's a good friend of the show, and a good friend of ours, and it was so cool meeting you guys from all over the fucking planet, man. Amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you for coming out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And of course, Arsequeef.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course, Arsequeef. Legitimately fantastic gentleman. This definitely will not be our last time to Europe. Don't worry, because that was amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Laura and I will get our travel situation fixed. We didn't know raw plutonium was not allowed in the UK. We travel with it always. It is a fantastic gem. Put it under the moonlight and it radiates.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's great is the longer you keep it next to Ronin, he doesn't actually have to feed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (deep voice) Hey, how you doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Points to Travis on that one. It's the ellipses at the end. Like a little squeak. Last we left off, The Mighty Nein, in pursuing a thread of a mysterious orb that seemed to connect in some way to the entity in which Fjord has somehow connect himself to, and as such been granted these strange eldritch powers, led you southward from the Menagerie Coast after commandeering a ship called The Mist, turned into The Mistake. Followed it through some dangerous reefs to a pirate ship called the Squalleater, and there on the captain, Avantika. You made a pact with her, where the choice was to either die or to help aid her and a companion she hired for this to help navigate this island. This strange, seemingly dangerous or cursed island, to which you made your way through the jungle of this Urukaxl. Managed to avoid lizardmen. Managed to barely sneak through a ancient city of yuan-ti. Making your way to the top of this temple and through the interior. A series of battles later, an encounter with a strange lightless internal orchard in which two of the fruit within had been eaten by two members of your team and have been tripping balls ever since.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's right. Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You made your way to the bottom, subterranean, guardian chamber, where you met a yuan-ti abomination that was laying guard to the true guardian: a large hydra. The hydra had turned around and laid waste to much of your party, but you managed to, through a series of clever choices, uses of fire magic, and some rapid assaults, managed to cleave all the heads from its body and kill it just in time. Its corpse now lying fresh on the ground, Captain Avantika seeming pleased and impressed by the display of the strange, new compatriots that have now come to work under her. You now sit in the stillness of this chamber, able to now finally take a moment to look about and see what secrets or mysteries it holds. So Mighty Nein, what would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was any of that real?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no. You're still...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We just need to wait this out. We killed all the creatures. How many eyes do I have right now? Because it feels like I have three of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You do. You have three eyes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's Avantika doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Avantika is sitting down for a second and getting her breath. The rest of you who are still up in the hallway, which is Jester, Caduceus, and Jamedi and Caleb, all begin to slowly descend the stairs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's so funny? Hey, zip it. The hydra, did it (sliding) back in the hole, or is it still out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's currently slung over the side of the staircase that curves down into the subterranean chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do they make you sound differently? It feels like you sound different because of the gloves. I think it's just in my head.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah! Y'all have Benadryl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two healing potions and an EpiPen. Hold on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was a thing. Caduceus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is Jamedi up there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In theory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jamedi's currently standing at the top, glancing around the side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I assure you, it's safe now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh yeah. Hey, you guy! How come you did not do anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was a guide. I was to delve. I am not skilled in the ways you are. I'm not stupid to throw myself "in front of a beast so large."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Worried you could maybe die?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was pretty touch-and-go. Do you want to sit back and stay safe and then get eaten? I am really not myself right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. You're being super aggro. It's intense.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is Jamedi wearing any weapons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, I'm going to use this new d20 and see how that goes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, where'd you get this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The con. Ah! That's good. That's a good start. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lot of browns, grays, and dull greens. He's definitely more of a scout and a tracker, based on his skill set from what you've seen, than any sort of frontline fighter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to go over to Avantika.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach, she gets up and rummages off the side and pulls off a small lantern she keeps notched on the side of her belt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see anything else tucked up under there while she is doing that that looks of interest or of importance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing in particular beyond what she previously had, that you can tell at the moment, no. It's a small lantern, maybe that big, and she pulls a piece of cloth out that was meant to keep it from clattering or making any noise on the inside. She pulls out the cloth, tucks it in her pocket, ignites the end of an oil wick. The lantern glows a bit and gives off some light. She begins walking along the walls of the inside of the chamber.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to cast Detect Magic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: On the lantern?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On everything. Including our friends and everything in the room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll mirror Avantika's movement on the other side of the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you cast Detect Magic, a few things. All of your friends give off a faint aura. Everything but Jamedi gives off a magical aura. You also sense the columns themselves have a fairly powerful, deep magical aura to them. That's the most you can see at the moment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing Jamedi is wearing at all is giving off a--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three figures. Then over the top of that, taking up probably 60 percent or more of this mural, you see a humongous bird of dark purple flame that is wreathing the sky above this crowd. You see its wings curved upward and then bent down, and where the wings end, fire curls and burns, and the feathers on the edges of these wings definitively come up into a purple and dark gray flame with bits and specks of deep red. At the top where its head looks down, the beak long and pointed, there are three eyes across its face, and in each of these eyes you see set a rather large onyx stone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a bird?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A large, flaming bird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a phoenix?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like a phoenix, but dark purples and grays and deep reds in color.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three eyes, each one is an onyx stone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably about that big.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Fjord, I feel like I should mention I'm keeping a lookout for anything and I'm getting a bit of a magical aura from the three columns. I don't know if it's related to this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you reading anything off of all of the eyes that I am seeing, those stones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing at the pillars, too, there's faint carved designs and shapes, like swirling, almost serpentine circles and curves that chain into each other and swirl off. Imagine a column made of chains, if you will, but the patterns are erratic in places and don't seem to follow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The three columns are very similar, there's nothing unique, the pattern within them doesn't deviate too much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can tell, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Each of these eyes is a separate amber piece about that big around, the size of a large gold piece, all along the coil of its body. At the very top, where it's rearing up, this very long, thin, pointed, almost lizard-like maw opens up, and behind it, this giant tidal wave is curling and frozen in place, looking like it's about to bear down on and either destroy or sweep away the crowd below it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Question: do the eyes in this picture bear any resemblance to the tattoos I spied through the window when I eavesdropped through Frumpkin on Fjord and Avantika's conversation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very much so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Very much so, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two eyes on this one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On this one, the head of it has three eyes as well, but the body itself has eyes evenly spaced around the entire length of its coiled body.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Und amber for the three eyes on the head, or every single time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every single eye on it is a piece of amber, matching size.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The eyes, they're there, right? It's part of the mural, they're not missing or recessed or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all appear to be present.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You described the first group looked humanoid, no strange features, just arms, legs, head, but for the second one with the serpent they're a little weird?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: More detail has been put into them. More care has been placed into their carving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Onyx eyes for the first creature...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Amber eyes for the second. What about the third? I'll go over and look at the far mural.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Avantika continues curving around with a big, wide-eyed smile on her face. As she passes by it, she goes, "This is incredible."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, it's very stimulating. Have you ever seen imagery like this before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can only assume this is carved by the Ki'Nau."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yep, the Ki'Nau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The quinoa?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, the Ki'Nau. They're the followers of Uk'otoa, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is correct."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Ki'Nau?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ki'Nau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She continues curving around. Beau and Caduceus, as you walk to the other wall, that side of the chamber, there you see a curling, thick worm of some kind. Its folded skin and tooth-like scales burrowing up to produce mountains over the crowd, cliff faces made of stone and rock breaking and about to plummet into the crowd below. There beneath it you see three figures once more elevated, the same wreath around them of some sort of radiance or light. The people below don't seem scared. There's no sign of fleeing or fear, just a gathering. Within this large, terrifying, worm-like creature, its form bulbous with these strange protrusions, these spine-like scales that you can imagine would pull it through the broken earth, you see this ring of teeth that accentuates where its mouth is, and on the inside, where a tongue would be, there instead are three eyes across the inside of its mouth. These appear to be made of some kind of ivory, some polished, white material.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. That is vivid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also the three figures on each wall, are they standard humanoid form?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not detailed enough to the point where you can see features to differentiate between elven, human, halfling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do they seem to be the same three on each, or is it just silhouettes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just silhouettes of three figures.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck, fuck, fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And this one is you," and goes and draws another face on the middle one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can see the resemblance. The question is, if that's you, and that's me, who's our third friend?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is a very good question."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You said you had met only one other Chosen before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Only one, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And what happened to them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They were a very informative partner. They are the one that introduced me to the great "possibility of power under Uk'otoa. We traveled this ocean for quite a number of years together, "but they proved to be a coward. They took something important to our mission and vanished, "and I have spent many years trying to recover what they stole. With no luck. I figured it was more "worth my time to pillage enough coin to pay other people to find them for me. And so far, based on "the fact that it brought you to me, a much more successful endeavor, eh?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed. This person that seemed to have shown you the light, did you try to track them down? Do you know anything about them or where they might be? They would seem to be very useful in our current situation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is very true. Well, it seems I may have some information. Let's get back to the ship, "eh? Let's finish our business here and let's talk over a glass of wine."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have not explored all of this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is true." She begins to make her way towards the well at the center of the chamber.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was heading that way myself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any writing of any kind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about at the pillars, you two can see within the shapes glowing runes that trace from ceiling to floor, then across the ground and all meet at the well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I able to read it with the Comprehend Languages that should still be cooking, because it's an hour-long spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not technically a language. These are runes. These are glyphs of some kind. Make an arcana check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, dice. Be good to me. No. That is a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are different epochs in historical time in which there have been advances and developments of arcane runes and sigils. There is the early basis of magical runes, which is a deviation of Draconic as a language, and then there are ways that they've been altered and made more efficient. These are very old, base, early Draconic runes. As such, they hold a lot more very primal magical power, and usually are reserved for larger rituals and magics that are meant to last for very long periods of time. The nature of the magic on these runes, from what you can tell, it's a little hard to get the direct essence, but there is some sort of an abjuration-based magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go investigate-- not the hydra, the creature that I killed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You head on over to the other yuan-ti, and as you approach, the body lies there, tongue lolling out and drool and blood, a mixture of thick saliva mingling with the dark black-purple blood out of the corner of its mouth, its eyes wide open and rolled back. Its dark, thick green scales of its snake-like head and thick, muscular scaled torso all lie limp across the stone where it was slain. Its blade has clattered to the ground a few feet from its grasp and its polished marble and silver shield scattered a few feet from its form. The rest of its tail coils and is limp off to the side from there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll rifle around looking for any keys or objects.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. You find on its body 26 pieces of gold. Only gold, no other pieces of coin on its body. The blade is a very, very large blade. It looks like it's well made, both for ceremonial purposes and for actual combat. It is both beautiful and very well made, and the shield itself is also exquisitely crafted and shows no signs of wear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take the shield and hang on to it until I can give it someone who wants it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. At this point, Avantika's walked to the edge of the well and looks down into the space below.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I walk up behind her and I go, huh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you really?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like, pushing her?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I don't actually push her in but I just want to freak her out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's going to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She whips around as you do that and both her hand grabs your wrist to deflect it and you wrench your wrist free as a natural instinct and you both have this moment of--

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA
lines.text: Eh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, I do have a solution I think for this. Jamedi! You worthless sack of shit, you haven't done a damn thing since we got in this temple. You like to scout ahead, go forward? Get your ass down that well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's still at the top of the stairs. He goes, "Well, for one thing, I was paid to go to "the temple, and no further. The fact that I have even come this far is because I need to claim my pay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you want, a cookie? Get down the fucking well, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Avantika goes, "Actually, I think ladies first."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I would insist to join you, if that is the case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "May the best one win." She dives in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit balls.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, Fjord! Can I talk to you for a second before you go down there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Real quick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is-- the pillars are covered when I do the shield-- when I cover myself and put the shield-- the columns have that in them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The pillars are magic?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but it's protection. It's holding something in or holding something back. We know what that thing is with the yellow eyes but what is the tapeworm?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. I don't want her to get too far ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a few things that I'd like to talk about.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you jump in. First off, Caleb's distraction has given her quite a lead. She's a fairly accomplished swimmer and is making her way down. This well continues on for a good 70, 80 or so feet below. The water is cold. It is salt water.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Salt water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Salt water, not brackish but salt water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. You are swimming after her?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mhm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check. You have advantage because the water is-- because of your armor, it's not giving you as much resistance heading south.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Athletics? 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to close the gap slowly, but she's eagerly swimming down with almost a fervor. As you get deeper into this column, this basin below, the walls begin to grow thick with algae and grime like a thick-- It could be a plant matter that's just accrued over the walls, or it could be waste matter from the hydra in its home that has slowly congealed to cover the walls. The stone begins to give way to this dark, slick material. Once you hit about the 70, 80 foot point, the tunnel begins to open like a giant bulb or internal, spherical chamber. Role another athletics check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heading deeper in, the saltiness of the water, the brininess, the flavor in your mouth gets more intense. What was once a semblance of sea water is definitively sea water, but also very strongly briny sea water. Make another athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The bulb-- we've entered that chamber, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's our visibility like? 40, 60?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For you, because you have dark vision, you can see within 30 feet of you, essentially. As far as you look the chamber is--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's not a lot of natural light, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That being the case, you don't see the bottom of the chamber, you just see it open--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And just her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And just her, but she's gaining.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: James Cameron going down to find the Titanic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just delving straight down into the darkness. Make another athletics check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20, okay. She did not role that well that time. She's beginning to tire, it seems, or at least you're starting to pick up speed. As you continue to follow, you get probably 40 or so feet from her, but she's still ahead of you. Role again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 20, nice! She rolled okay. You see, now, the bottom begin to approach. In the peripheral of your dark vision, the floor greets to meet you and you pick up enough speed to where you both impact the bottom of this chamber at the same time. You both hit. She looks up at you, and your eyes meet. A few bubbles escape from her mouth and you see her big, wide, toothy grin and she begins scraping grime off the floor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do the same.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know what I'm looking for. 23.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the two of you are currently scraping bits of grime and algae off the ground, there are bits of plants that are growing up like lightless kelp that seems to have made some sort of a living down here in this subterranean, water-filled chamber. As you're pushing through and scraping around, your hand scoops this large bit of grime from in front of you and you can see a stone relief at the very base of the bottom, a concave, spherical shape about the size of a fist.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I try and stick my hand in my chest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it go anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go and jam your hand and its hitting your armor. You have a full-on leather plate right there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know what to do. Like the size of a fist? It's a sphere, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about that big, and you can see it is concave. It's about the size of the stone that you'd found.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's in my body.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Poop it out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know how! I don't have an eject button! Can I summon the falchion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. The falchion appears in your hand, and as you do this bright, yellow light is now emanating from the center of its hilt where the eye itself is glowing with its own lantern-like source. At which point Avantika is now rushing towards that thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Something's about to happen and I just jam the eye into the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an initiative roll. Because you gave her enough time to get up right next to you and now we're going to see who gets to it first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you, looking around, suddenly see this dull blue glow begin to get brighter from within this well. You watch as these runes, that you guys didn't notice except for the two of you before, begin to suddenly glow up the sides. The three pillars suddenly begin to spiral and glow as all these runes come to life. Avantika pulls back and looks back at her hand, she looks back at you, her eyes blink for a second, and she just smiles and you hear this earth-shuddering, soulful crack sound rocks the entirety of the temple. Bubbles suddenly, this one burst of air that had been trapped in the ground below, is all immediately released as one and rises the water above. You can look around and see the interior of this; there is a heavy black crack in the stone of this chamber as you guys all hear this earth-shattering bam! Dust falls off the ceiling of this chamber from the inside. The pillars themselves still stand, but there are multiple places in this chamber now where these large black cracks now seem to have snaked their way in one instant burst across parts of the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They are picking the lock on this safe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The glowing runes blink out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think the lock's picked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe. They might need three. There's two of three. I'm eyeing Jamedi as I say that. Presumably just two of three. As long as it's just one, maybe Fjord is thinking better of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I immediately start searching on the ground for another opening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's not all here. Maybe it's in another location. Maybe there are two other temples.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You start pulling through the weeds and the kelp and the grime and-- nothing. It's all smooth stone except for this one little alcove that you found first. Avantika is now swimming frantically up towards the surface.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Frantically?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just trying to kick. She lost quite a bit of air.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go grab her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go grab her? Okay. Make a grapple check-- make an athletics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stone cold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, she kicks right out of your grasp. She looks back with an expression of surprise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm pointing at the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm okay at those.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Travis, you have your fate, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks confused and continues swimming upward, not reading too much into it. She continues to clamber up to the surface. The rest of you, as you're looking about, the surface of the water begins to spill over the sides of the well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to start heading towards the stairs. I'm going to recommend everybody else, let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds good, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're already at knee height.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He likes water. He'll be fine. Come on! Let's get out of here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I stand with Jester at the edge of the pool, looking down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you guys, glancing down. Jamedi's back in the chamber, his eyes wide, goes, "We should "go. Bring her back, she owes me money!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm grabbing Nott by the scruff and dragging her up the stairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't have to drag me, I'm going!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys all begin to climb up the stairs, the chamber is filling very quickly with the water. It's now reaching the base of the stairs, at which point, as you guys-- Beau, you and Jester, there's just enough water now where your buoyancy carries you off your feet and you're now actually treading water in the chamber. At which point Avantika makes it to the surface with a large gasp of air, and but a few moments later Fjord also breaks the surface.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, Fjord, let's get out of here!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, what's happening?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The water! Bad water! All water's bad, but this is even worse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What the hell happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's continuing to fill. The stairway that's leading upward, the water has now reached the base of the doorway, and you have a few moments, maybe six seconds or so before the doorway itself is completely filled with water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're all going into a full swim here, double move, half speed for all of you guys, so it's going to take you a little bit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm walking up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the orchard, that's right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Were there-- There were stairs up the sides, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Weren't there spiral stairways?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there is the fountain, but it has been-- It rose back up to the top when this chamber door was opened.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, so there's no stairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, no. It's raised up and closed off, the front, when you opened the doorway to get deeper into the basement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we see to the ceiling of this chamber?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. With you, disadvantage because you are human.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eyes up. Make a perception, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the pillar that holds the fountain at the top, and there are the stairs, still part of it, and you can see where it's up there, but whatever mechanism, rocks--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's stuck up there, ja?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's climb!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to-- Is everybody outside?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is everybody in the chamber right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking hourglass, damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The central chamber is now-- The water has now reached the base of orchard and is now filling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hit the button to re-close the-- to close the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know the button, you never found it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, who did?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know, who did?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was Nott.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, do you mind hitting the button to close this thing again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes! Sure! It was one of these holes. I'm going to just pick one. I go to the north one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you go to the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, god, which one was it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. I don't remember. I'm just going to go into one of-- Aren't these-- there's little holes, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are. As you can see now, the water that has begun to fill up the chamber is taking-- It's a little slower in here, because it's a much wider space now, but you can see eggs starting to flow, float out from the other chambers. The other two rooms were the two hatchery areas where you saw the larger eggs were set.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. Hang on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I remember which one was the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine. Oh, plus six? No, this is not a saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's just straight bonus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus three? So, 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You recall it was in the chamber where you're standing, and it's not too far from the stairs where you guys descended below.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Do I see a little door, a little hole near where I'm standing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look over to the side. Make a quick investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You reach over, and you find it, and you hit it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door slams shut and locks you in the room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Locks me--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a grinding on the other side of the chamber of the fountain lowering.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fountain lowering?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So the fountain lowered, but Nott is trapped inside--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, and everybody else who hasn't left that chamber, is inside. The only people that said they were leaving that room, I believe, were Caduceus, who was going up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I was going because I was-- oh, god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So all of you are now locked in the chamber with Nott.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, wait, can you open it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, we're in the chamber? We're all inside there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're all in the chamber with Nott, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That chamber goes downstairs, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will open it up again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fountain raises up, the chamber opens up again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mage Hand! Come on!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on out!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everybody out! I cast Mage Hand!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door slams shut, the two other doors slam shut. The chamber now is about waist high in water, and you watch as the pillar begins to slowly lower. It is a slow drag down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, let's go. Come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to climb up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The stairway itself, if you recall, ends a little bit ways up, and there's a bit of a drop down to get to it. It slowly comes down and does meet the floor. There's a bit of a lip to get up there now, so if you ascend to the top of the staircase, there is about a ten foot or so jump where it is smooth walls before you can actually get to the top floor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll get up there and drop a rope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I can do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's try that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like to make the jump? Do you want to jump off of Yasha or anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can Yasha fly?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give me a boost, the cheerleader hoist?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha goes over and gives you a boost. That gives you advantage on your acrobatics check to try and parkour up the stairs and leap off the sides.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jesus Christ!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to cast Dancing Lights and send four globules up around the roof so that everyone can see everything perfectly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 12 on my acrobatics.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You leap, slide off the side and manage to fall down into the water next to it. You come out of the surface. The chamber is now halfway full, and it's almost starting to reach to the top.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's really slippy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and-- Oh, god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give me a boost!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you're tall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I'm actually weak, somebody stronger is probably good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to scurry up Mr. Clay and jump.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, I cast Enlarge on Caduceus so he's twice his size!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mighty Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm tall now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very tall. I might be taller than the hole.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 15 feet tall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're tall enough to the point where I'd say, because it's double the size, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Double the size, ja.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're 14 feet. You're not tall enough for the whole chamber, but you're tall enough to push people through.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right, yeah. I'm pushing people through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Alley oop-ing one after the other, you grab each person and lift them up. Like a little booster into the chamber. One by one, you guys all get up into the top now, and Caduceus, you're too big to get up--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, Caduceus, hold Fjord's hand. Fjord, hold his hand, you got it?

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I cast Reduce, and now he is half his size.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pull him up top.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull Caduceus up. You guys are now in the chamber, standing there, there's the stairs that lead up. At which point you hear footfalls, and you see coming around the corner down-- It seems that the sound of the resounding crack in this temple has drawn the attention of three yuan-ti. They turn the corner, you see one of them, two snake arms a familiar sight as one of the malisons comes down and two broodguard are there. What are you doing? The water is now spilling up past out of the hole, and now the top room is now starting to fill with water.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So are we in the top level now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are. Yep-eb-eb. I'm tapped spell-wise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just going to just go (screaming) and start shooting at the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not great, it's a 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point the water seems to have accelerated and has now filled the chamber. As you fire--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm casting Spirit Guardians and rushing them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're now underwater. You take your last breath, and you've all completely been submerged in this chamber. The other yuan-ti you can see in the darkness below here, the only bit of light that you have are the globes still from you. Although, are those concentration?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a light on my stick anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, they're gone then because Enlarge, Reduce.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would have cast Light on my stick, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're casting Light on your stick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anybody I don't like within 15 feet is currently getting ransacked by tiny fairies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love it. What's the save on that? Wisdom, I believe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wisdom 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the malison succeeds, the two broodguard fail. Roll damage on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's-- Freaking out a little bit. 3d8 radiant damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 11 (counting) 12 points of radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 point of radiant damage, nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: None of that was like a melee attack or anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because your damage is reduced since you're teeny.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It doesn't-- They're fairies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm heading straight towards the exit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was the roll you had to hit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. That will hit the malison. You do not get sneak attack, however.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's fine. It causes nine hit points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. That finishes your go there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would probably bonus action-- if I had a bonus action I would shoot again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd allow it. Because we'll say you're like-- You were standing on the water so as you're leaning over the surface you're like squeezing it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16 to hit again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Another 11 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 points of damage, good. So, I now need everyone to roll initiative.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I'm on top of the water, how much space do I have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, now you don't anymore. The water surface begins to crush underneath you and then you have to delve underneath as it meets it. It's filled up and it's now making its way up the stairs, towards the top of the temple. So, 25 to 20, anyone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll roll for Jester. Terrible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And roll for Yasha.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha got 13. Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Ten to five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven and seven. Both seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seven over here as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine over here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, Caduceus, Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott and then Cad--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rolled a natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb and Jester?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester had a seven.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then Fjord at the bottom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, Dante, could you please describe the-- Where everyone is physically, the enemies and us? Just so I can see it in my head a bit better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. That was my Dante.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Want the hourglass gone. They freak me out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay, it just means you guys are now in the process of slowly drowning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mercer, don't say that! (groaning)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond. And Tor Books everybody. Tor Books, Tor Books, Tor Books.

lines.name: LIAM, TRAVIS
lines.text: Tor Books, Tor Books, Tor Books.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tor Books, Tor Books, Tor Books.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tor Books, Tor Books, Tor Books.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw, shit. We're back here again? Drowning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Except now it's filled with water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! How did you do that? (exclamations)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone hates the underwater levels.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're also drowning too, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, since they're not officially in this-- Now that we are in combat--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (water breathing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is the nature--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't we have some water breathing potions? Somewhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caduceus just made his way up there. There's Beau, and there's Jamedi.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Someone might have a water breathing potion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Top of the initiative order. Beau, you're up first. While you're in water, movement is considered difficult terrain. If I recall, attacks are made at disadvantage while in water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we see the entrance or exit ahead of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those are the stairs that lead upward, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, if we just book it, we'll go--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's an option.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're just going to have these guys--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is entirely an option you can do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I'm a human with no magical abilities, so I'm going to run.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, the trapdoor--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter) Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't do a whole lot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have throwing stars.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (pitiful noise of a throwing star flying uselessly through water)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We haven't given her the key to the trapdoor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, ja, son of Sparta, the trapdoor into this place was like a metal grate, wasn't it? Not fully-- like, there were holes? Was it a metal grate, or was it solid?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were holes above, but they were in the ceiling, and they were part of the stonework. Up top, there was an actual trapdoor that you had locked behind you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but not like metal with holes for the water to go through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That you know of. There are holes above, which is where the sacrificial blood would drip through into the fountain. So, what are you doing, guys? Are you running first?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're swimming?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm swimming up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (counting)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to spend a ki point to do Step of the Wind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau is also--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've made it up the top.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is she hitting the trapdoor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, she's not out of the temple. She's heading up the stairs. She's out of the battle for the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The malisons closest are going to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is he getting within 15 feet of me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, then. As he enters that space, he has to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, he's still within 15 feet of you. So at the top of his turn, he takes the save?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your speed is halved while you're within 15 feet of me, and the creature enters the area for the first time or starts its turn there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Natural 20 on its save, so it takes half damage. It still takes damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So, the 3d8, that's 19. So, half of 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So nine. This burst of radiant energy inside-- (growling) There's bubbles that escape from its mouth. It's going to come forward and take two swipes at you, Fjord, with both of its serpent hands.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That is a 16 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a natural 20, but it has disadvantage because it's in water. That is still a 19 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do manage to take-- from one serpent, you just manage to glide out of the way in the middle of the water. The second one, that is four plus three, seven piercing damage, including ten points of poison damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck, ten poison?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it diluted by the water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, no, because it's straight from the fangs in your bloodstream. It surges pain in your chest. You also lose a bit of air instinctively from the pain. So, consider now, your air supply is halved.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Is that half my Constitution modifier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, the DC is going higher when we start getting to that, depending on how long we're down here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends his go. Now it's the two broodguards.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Root guards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Broodguards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so he gets into my realm-- one of them is within--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're both already within the radius, so they both have to make wisdom saves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't have to reroll, it's the same for all three, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the top of the turn. It's a different turn, so roll again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The roll I just used, or a new roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's the top of their turn, it happens.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. That's--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, Spirit Guardians happens at the top of the turn, it doesn't happen immediately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, top of their turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, at the top of their turn. So the damage they would've taken this turn, they've already taken. So, we'll let that happen. Marking that down. Good to remember. They both move forward. One broodguard is going to attack you, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to do two claw attacks and a bite attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage on each, though. The first one is a 15?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One claw attack just goes wide. The other one, 16.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This giant, serpentine mouth out of its weird, lizard-like body is going to strike out and bite you. Oh, two tens. That's 14 to hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha was not raging. So the first one with disadvantage is 15 to hit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, eight points of slashing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next attack with a claw with disadvantage, natural one. That is a complete miss. Yasha takes one claw and (grunting) barely affects it. The other one, she grabs its hand in the middle of the grasp and pushes it back. She grabs her sword, ready now. As she is going to get her blade ready, it's going to bite towards the front of her jaw and chest. That is 17.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes six points of piercing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends the broodguards' turn. Yasha's up next.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha's up next. Cool. 14 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha's also lost quite a bit of air on that turn. Those two hits that hit her? Mark down two hits of oxygen loss on her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping tabs on this. This will come into play in a bit, depending on what happens.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where is she on the map?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's right there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh huh. She's in melee with someone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's in melee with the broodguard, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter) Okay, she has to fight because she's going to get hit again, and that would be bad for her right now. With her bonus action, she would like to rage. She will take two attacks at the one that she's in melee with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's in a rage? She has the reckless.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Already got the reckless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so that just makes it a straight attack because she has disadvantage underwater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, balls and ass. Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Balls and ass. Ass, ass and balls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Definitely hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 3d6-- (counting) 13 points of damage for the first one. The second one is a straight roll, the same thing, 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, hits. That's just 2d6.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 2d6-- again, 13 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one's looking really bad. After the blasts that it took from the Spirit Guardians, and the two strikes from Yasha, you can see now there's a cloud of dark crimson in the water around it. It's thrashing about in pain. You can see it looking a bit woozy in the dark water. That finishes Yasha? You going to move at all?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She will not move at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She can move around it. As long as she stays in melee, she can still move around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll come in melee, just more-- closer to the stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I got you. That's what I figured. That finishes Yasha's turn. Nott's up next.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who had I shot before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had shot this one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I do something unconventional here, Matt, and undo my last shot? So, give him back 11 points of damage. Because I'm holding a keg of gunpowder and there's no way I can reload a crossbow while holding a keg of gunpowder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can drop it for the moment, fire it, and pick it back up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll let that happen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good job, Ketchup.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because there is water, and it's already soaking. It's like-- (splashing, crossbow firing)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say, narratively, it makes sense.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's slowly starting to sink

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which is a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Melee spell attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Melee spell attack, so I roll at disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine plus six, 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 hits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: AC is 14.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm at 5th level, so it's 2d8. What's a d8?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like a little-- there you go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, eight points of damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage to it. As you reach out and grab it-- (electric shock) You watch as its tongue retracts into its head and its eyes go wide. (pained noise) It loses some air, and it eventually shakes and pushes off your hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a verbal spell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Verbal. You have to speak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do it, but you lose a bunch of air to do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, boy! I hate water. I'm going to swim away, as fast as I can. I still have to disengage, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will bonus action disengage and swim around past Fjord. Yeah, around this way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is as far as you can get.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Going towards the exits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Swimming over--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With one hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is your go, Nott. It is now Caduceus, Caleb, and Jester. You guys can decide amongst yourselves the order.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go last.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll go first because I'm scared. I'm going to use my air to cast Expeditious Retreat on myself. So I, too, am going to spit out some air and do this in the water. That doubles my speed, which I can use a bonus action for dashing, plus my movement. I will swim up five feet and then towards the stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (counting) That gets you about there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're right about there on the steps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Swimming through the air. Okay, that finishes Caleb's go. What's Jester doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester would like to probably--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's going to lose a little air, but yeah. Is she engaged with anybody?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's engaged with this broodguard right there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, then she will Toll the Dead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She will cast Toll the Dead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a saving throw for him. What's the save?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 15 wisdom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 13. That does not do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 2d8.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d12, I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah. 2d12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's already taken damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where are my 12s?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, question: Matt, did you move me two groups of movement? Because it would be for the bonus action, action, and movement. So it'd be one more third.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Casting the spell's a bonus action.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you cast it, you get that extra juice, and then bonus action on every following round?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so yeah, you'd be up there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Thank you for the heads up on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points? Oof. Yeah, he's not looking good either. They're both looking pretty rough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's going to try to get the most advantageous point towards the door as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She is currently-- Both of you, since you cast spells, mark five points of lost air.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five points of lost air.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just going to remember that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have five? Total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the purposes of this challenge, to keep it interesting, five points before you're now starting to make-- is now considered how long you can hold your breath going forward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Each hit's a minute off the-- I'll have to look at how I worked it out here. Essentially, at this point now, Jester and Nott are going to have to start making constitution saving throws each round.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (panicked breathing) I was not prepared for this so fast!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes Jester's go. She moves around over there, behind the side. Caduceus, what're you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a blight staff swing at that one that's right next to Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Blight staff swing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are a tiny man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage on the attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, actually, that's true. Actually, never mind. I'm not going to do that, I'm so sorry. I'm going to get them into the most advantageous position to make sure that everybody I want to hit is within 15 feet of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're going to swim up on top of the fountain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just going to hold my breath and maintain my calm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that all you're doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, ends Caduceus' go. Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, can I fire one Eldritch Blast and make a melee attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It's two Eldritch Blasts or two strikes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great. I'm going to fire an Eldritch Blast at the dick that's with Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Roll for attack with disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, that's fine. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits. Roll damage on him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 1d10 for nine points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine points of damage, all righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is he still up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still up. Hurt, but still up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will send the other one that way as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't let Ash's character die. Awesome, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits again. Roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For 11 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 points of damage. That'll do it. You hear the dull impact of the Eldritch Blast, and the second (impact) under the water. In that flash of light, that second sickly, green glow flash in the water, one of the broodguards begins to float up limply towards the ceiling, no longer alive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Check his body for gold!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to move away. I'm going to use my 30 feet and take an attack of opportunity as I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will get you right about there on the stairs. There you go, that'll do. You'll swim right there; that's perfect. It does get to swipe at you with disadvantage. That's going to be nine plus five, that's 14.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So it misses?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does! It scrapes across your shield as you swim away quickly, just barely making it! That finishes your turn, Fjord. Beau, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, what do I see? Where am I? Quick look around!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going up the staircase, but you're part way up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The water's still filling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, still filling, and it's still above you, like you can maybe catch up to the top if you want to. If you use your full movement, you'll get up to the top where the door is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to keep moving upwards, and while I'm doing that, I want to take out the 50-foot rope we have. Then I want to grab something heavy that I have. I've got to have something stupid and heavy that I don't care about, and I want to tie it to the other end. A crowbar! I take the crowbar and then tie it, and I drop it down the well with the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Downstairs, you mean?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You tie, take the crowbar and throw it behind so it's like (bouncing) and rolls partway down the stairs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to take the rope and double-grab it around me and keep hauling ass up the stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, with that, you'll make it all the way to the top. You get to the small inner chamber, which is now halfway to stomach-filled. Making it to the top, you look up and you can see there is-- it's a little bit crouch-down, there is the latch, and there is the lock mechanism beneath it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck! It's locked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You locked it behind you when you guys entered the temple.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who has the fucking key? One of us has the key; who has the key?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a key? Where's the key?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who found the key?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Somebody found the key. It was on one of the guys from the first encounter of this chamber.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Snake temple key! It says it right here on the equipment list. Jester has it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester has the key!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the DC?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Spirit Guardians? 16!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? So roll full damage on that. 3d8.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not bad. 16 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 points of damage. Ooh, he's looking really bad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are the other two not doing anything, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When it comes to their turn. One of them's dead now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I mean our other two friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other two, their turn's next. We'll get to that when he finishes his turn, but one of them is dead, so there's only one other guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of the serpent arms look up towards Caduceus, the source of these angry spirits, and is going to make two strikes against him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're the one right there. That is 13 to hit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second strike, that's a 12!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like 18, six; 16, eight. Bad rolls! Both serpent strikes from its arms reach out towards you, and Caduceus, you're tiny enough right now. Although, are you still holding the tiny spell on Caduceus?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have not released it yet, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is Expeditious Retreat concentration?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, is it? 'Tis, so it's dropped, so he's regular size.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're regular form, and you bear down with the shield, and deflect both.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just letting the fairies do the work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes its go. The other broodguard has to make another save, that is a seven plus-- no, that does not make it, so full damage on the other broodguard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we getting the impression that they're totally comfortable underwater?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 15 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 points of damage, that'll do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, it does?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy also sparks and dies in the water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go Jester, go Jester, go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's Caduceus' spell. That finishes their go. Yasha's up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha will fucking hi-ho silver out that bitch! She has 40 feet, so 20--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no. She's out, I thought. She's out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Got you. (counting) Then moving the rest way up, that will get her halfway up the steps. Put her there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, get her out of there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Finishing Yasha's turn, Nott, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would appreciate it, but up to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Man, I really don't like this water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. No one does.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy, all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shades of the kraken battle returning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are Avantika and Jamedi doing anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will doggy paddle towards the snake-hand man and hit him with another zap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jamedi has essentially just swam around this whole thing--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Asshole!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's cocked. That still hits because its armor class is only 12. Ten points of damage. Second strike with the rapier, disadvantage. That does not hit! The dagger strike-- no. Misses again! Swinging out, piercing through the water with the rapier and the dagger and just to scrape across the side of its body but most of the strikes go wide and she's swimming around this way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
